comments:
Starting our RCP application, we are seeing the following stack

2006/06/13 14:16:06.65 SEVERE cm) Error while calling back ManagedService[Factory]. Configuration''s pid is org.eclipse.equinox.http.Http ::thread=Thread-3 ::loggername=OSGiLog(com.ibm.osg.service.cm)

	java.lang.RuntimeException: ServiceEvent.getServiceReference() is null
	at org.eclipsei.equinox.event.mapper.ConfigurationEventAdapter.convert(ConfigurationEventAdapter.java:58)
	at org.eclipsei.equinox.event.mapper.EventAdapter.redeliver(EventAdapter.java:40)
	at org.eclipsei.equinox.event.mapper.EventRedeliverer.configurationEvent(EventRedeliverer.java:254)
	at com.ibm.osg.service.cm.CMEventManager.run(CMEventManager.java:117)

Need some more information:

- How do we reproduce?
- What bundles are installed?
- It looks like you have an implementation of configuration admin.  Are you using ConfigAdmin when this happens?
This happened once while starting Hannover.  Its using the WED provided ConfigAdmin.  I haven't been able to reproduce it again with the debugger to at least get a clue as to what the event was.

This problem occurs when our application crashes and we restart.

The first two items on the eventQueue have null refs.
The first item is from 
[0]	CMEvent  (id=82)	
	factoryPid	null	
	ms	Activator  (id=89)	
	msf	null	
	pid	"org.eclipse.equinox.log.Log"	
	props	null	
	reference	null	
	type	1	
The second item is
[1]	CMEvent  (id=155)	
	factoryPid	null	
	ms	HttpConfiguration  (id=163)	
	msf	null	
	pid	"org.eclipse.equinox.http.Http"	
	props	null
